message:
I think that stars are wrong for their current function.

What is a star?
Stars are a way of letting people know that you like what they wrote. Maybe it's funny, maybe it's insightful, or maybe it's just useful information, but whatever the reason, a star lets you know it's good.

Umm, that's like a Thumbs Up, an up vote, +rep, or +karma, or something. A star, as seen in Firefox, Chrome, Gmail, and many other places, is usually a way to bookmark or favorite things. You can't find your starred messages anywhere (that I'm aware of).

It's stupidly inconsistent with other software. Something that's very easy to fix, too.
yeah, a single post without the whole context is rarely meaningful
@rcs Exactly, just like YouTube's Activity Sharing... http://d.pr/fBto
@frantiic it would also be nice to be able to share a stared posting on twitter/facebook. This would help get the word out about convore as well.

but they have a way to share a group and i think that is a better way to share the site, i mean if someone linked me to a star i would be like ok cool bit of info, and just leave, but if you someone links me to a group i would want to interact with the group and stay, stars serve an internal purpose
